result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon J. Decorah

defendant.name: Decorah, Devon J.
defendant.address: PO Box 341, c/o Celeste Goff, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
17CF68 & 15CM260:  Defendant appears in custody in person with SPD Travis Satorius.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  He will waive the prelim on the felony case and plea to Counts 1 and 2 with remaining counts DRI and 15CM260 DRI as well.  Victim is present in the courtroom.  Court performs colloquy with defendant regarding his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds he FVKI is waiving his right to the preliminary hearing on 17CF68 and is bound over for trial.  The Information will be e-filed and will be the same charges as the complaint.  No objections to proceed without the Information now.  Defense waives reading of the Information.  Plea to Count 1 - No contest; Court reviewed charge and elements.  Plea to Count 2 - No contest; Court reviews charge and elements.  Court performs plea/wavier of rights colloquy with defendant.  States he understands the charges he is pleading to today.  He states he understands his rights and is waiving them today.  Felony warning given.  Defense stipulates to factual basis in the complaint for the pleas.  Court finds he FVKI waives his rights and enters his pleas and is found guilty of Counts 1 & 2 in 17CF68.  Count 3 of 17CF68 and all charges in 15CM260 are dismissed and read-in.

Victim makes a statement to the Court.  SPD Satorius has discussion with his client and the defendant still wishes to proceed today.  Victim rescinds her request for restitution.  ADA Inlow still believes 15CM260 should be a read-in.  Defendant still wishes to proceed as stated.  

State recommends:  Sentence be withheld and place on 3 years probation with conditons:  Must submit a DNA sample, no alcohol, no drugs, use only 1 pharmacy and provide that info to agent, AODA assessment and sign releases, employment, any other recommendations of agent including mental health evaluation, no contact with known drug users or dealers, ???, be allowed to expunge if probation is successfully completed.  Attorney Satorius makes his recommendation for sentencing for 2 years probation with conditions.  Defendant excercises his right to allocution and makes a statement to the Court.   

Court adopts the joint recommendation and withholds sentence and places on probation for 3 years with the following conditions:    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.  Must use 1 pharmacy only for prescriptions and must identify that pharmacy to agent.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants.  Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming, including mental health as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample.  Must seek and maintain employment commensurate to treatment plan and when ordered to do so by agent.  May apply for early release after 2 years if in compliance with conditions.  May petition for expungment is all conditions successfully completed.  Must may the court costs including the DNA surcharge.  No restitution ordered.  Must comply with any other recommendations of probation agent.  Granted 139 days credit if later revoked.
Amended Restitution Summary for C.L.G.
